title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
That Macbook came in with minor water damaged, some rails were cut off I was able to run jumpers to reconnect all the lines but apparently macbook is coming on ok but without any images or backlight, the caplocks on the keyboard light is on but there s no display or back light, I checked diode mode reading to ground of the connector J9000  all pads reading are fine , but no voltages when checking the voltages, 

Please help me out .

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
Did you test external video?

Don't you get 3V at pin 4 of J9000?
LCD EEPROM requires this voltage first.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: Yes, 3.3v is present at pin 4 of J9000.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
"Did you test external video?"

Voltage and diode mode at pins 6 & 7?
Be sure L9010/11 and all LVDS Transmitter Termination resistors are good.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
No I have not tested any external video yet , 

Pin 6&7  diode mode reading is 0.473 both pads and voltage is 1.8V , I reviewed L9010.11 they are looking good and all the resistors are also looking fine but i did not test them.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
You should get aprox 3V at pins 6 & 7; check with LCD disconnected too.

May have problems with U9270 and probably GPU.
If missing external video, try to disable GPU.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: Pins 6&7 with lcd connected is giving 3V , That laptop does not have HDMI lcd connector to try an external  LCD , I will try that tomorow or if you have another method to connect an external video you can please give me the tips to do so , next thing , How do i disable GPU?

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
"J9000  all pads reading are fine , but no voltages when checking the voltages
.............................
 Pin 6&7 ... voltage is 1.8V 
..............................................
Pins 6&7 with lcd connected is giving 3V"
Please, post accurate information.

Check LCD_PWR_EN and pins 2/3 voltage (J9000).
BTW, keep LCD connected, when you check voltages on video area.

"That laptop does not have HDMI lcd connector to try an external  LCD , I will try that tomorow or if you have another method to connect an external video"
Don't you have DisplayPort adapter?

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: Sorry about the misleading , When I Checked  LCD_PWR_EN Voltage of pin 2/3 Of (J9000). I have 0.00V , I dont have a display adapter here for that model,

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
LCD_PWR_EN   = 0.012V and  pin 2/3 of J9000   = 0.00V 

I dont have a display port adapter for that Model.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
Looks like LCD is not detected, or is bad.

This shouldn't be GPU problem.
But you can try to disable it, just in case.
Do it in BIOS, with Medusa; is the fastest way.
GMUX flashing is another option.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: But  I have another donor board which is coming on , I tested the LCD on the donor board and it powers on normal.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: Any other suggestions, the LCD works fine with my donor board so its not a LCD issue , do you Think   J9000  fpc might be my issue , I am seeing it like it was forced i am not sure if It has inner pin isse , should i just replace j9000 FPC connector?

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
Replace it, if in doubts.
I already understood that LCD is good.
So is not recognized because of other problem; bad connector, broken/corroded trace, or knocked off component.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: Great, I was able to replaced the connector , and BOOM  display starts working , but there s another little issue , I wouldn't read certain Hard Drive. it would load to 85% and give a white screen then restart. Any suggestions ?

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
This looks like GPU issue.
Image breaks when GPU driver starts to load.
Check if boots in safe mode.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: But Funny thing is , I Have tried 2  other hard drives and they booted very fine , that was why i  was not pointing directly at the gpu,  I have also purposely inserted a Hard drive without any OS on it and it read that the Hard drive was blank, Let me know if that could also be the Cable join the hard drive to the The board , seems like the owner of the device was playing rough trying to do her own thing on it , I will try in safe mode to see.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: You can try booting USB macOS...

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: ok. I ill try that

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: That macbook is still not reading the SSD even in safe mode , i would load to 85% then giving a white screen, I have also tried   USB macOS..  but still doing the same.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message:
How not reading, if you get 85% of progress bar?
Don't make such confusion.

So you have some HDD which can enter macOS, and other no?

Test with Windows, or Linux live.

title: Macbook A1297 820-2914 No DIsplay no Backlight
message: I will try with windows to see , I will
